abstract: Police in Cologne, Germany, after publishing first photos from New Year's Eve celebrations that turned into mass sexual attacks and robberies, announce detention of two men suspected of involvement; more than 1,000 reported assaults occurred, many of which have been attributed to recently arrived refugees from North Africa.
lead_paragraph: A 26-year-old Algerian and a 31-year-old Iraqi were detained in the investigation into hundreds of sex attacks and robberies on Dec. 31 in the German city.

headline.main: Cologne Police Detain 2 Suspects in New Year’s Eve Attacks
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Germany: Cologne Suspects Found

snippet: A 26-year-old Algerian and a 31-year-old Iraqi were detained in the investigation into hundreds of sex attacks and robberies on Dec. 31 in the German city.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
